metadata.title: Appeals and Complaints Policy â€“ Detailed Appeals Process

clauses.text: You may submit an appeal if you want the University to review a decision or outcome that has directly impacted your studies. The types of outcomes you can appeal are listed below. International students can appeal additional University decisions.
To submit an appeal, complete the correct form with supporting documentation and evidence by the stated deadline. Different forms have specific grounds of appeal and submission timelines.
Students may appeal their final grade after first requesting a review with their course coordinator or program manager (Stage 1).
If unresolved, students may submit an appeal using the 'Appeal against a final course assessment result form (PDF, 555KB)' to their College (Stage 2).
Stage 1 review should occur within 5 working days of result publication, and Stage 2 appeal within 20 working days.
Both stages must be completed before escalating to the University Appeals Committee.
To appeal a denied credit or RPL outcome, request a review from your school or college by replying to the outcome email (Stage 1).
If unresolved, submit an 'Appeal against recognition of prior learning (RPL) and credit transfer form (PDF, 529KB)' to your College (Stage 2).
Stage 1 within 5 working days of receiving the outcome; Stage 2 within 20 working days of the initial outcome.
Students may appeal a College Appeals Committee decision if there was a breach of University regulation, policy, or process that significantly impacted the outcome.
Submit the 'Appeal against the outcome from a College Appeals Committee form (PDF, 519KB)' to the University Appeals Committee within 10 working days of the outcome.
Students may appeal a denied special consideration outcome using the 'Appeal against a special consideration outcome form (PDF, 520KB)' submitted to the University Appeals Committee.
The appeal must be submitted within 10 working days of the special consideration decision.

sections.section_title: Equitable or Alternative Assessment Arrangement Appeals

clauses.text: To appeal a denied equitable or alternative assessment arrangement, complete the 'Appeal against an equitable or alternative assessment arrangement outcome form (PDF, 541KB)'.
Submit the form to the University Appeals Committee within 10 working days of the decision.
Students may appeal exclusion from their program due to unsatisfactory academic progress by submitting the 'Appeal against exclusion form (PDF, 521KB)' to the University Appeals Committee.
The appeal must be submitted within 20 working days of receiving the exclusion notification.
Students must be enrolled or on an approved leave of absence when submitting the appeal.
HDR candidates may appeal the termination of their candidature using the 'Appeal against termination of HDR candidature form (PDF, 518KB)'.
The appeal must be submitted to the University Appeals Committee within 20 working days of receiving the termination notification.
HDR students may appeal a failed examination outcome if there was a breach of University regulation, policy, or process that impacted the result.
Submit the 'Appeal against the outcome of a thesis/project examination form (PDF, 521KB)' to the University Appeals Committee within 20 working days of result publication.
Students may appeal a misconduct decision by a senior officer or the Student Conduct Board only if procedural rules were breached or the decision was unreasonable.
Appeals are submitted using the 'Appeal against a student misconduct decision form (PDF, 522KB)' to the Student Conduct Appeals Committee.
Appeals must be lodged within 20 working days of the misconduct outcome.
